subject: Productivity
title: Email and the Attention Crisis
description: A quick, practical guide to Email and the Attention Crisis.

hook.text: The average office worker checks email 77 times per day. Each check costs minutes of focus.

buildup.text: Email promised efficiency. Instead it created an endless stream of low-priority interruptions.

discovery.text: Gloria Mark found that after an interruption, it takes an average of 23 minutes to refocus.

twist.text: Email didn't save time. It redistributed time from deep work to shallow communication.

climax.text: Batch processing email at set times is now a standard productivity recommendation.

punchline.text: Email was meant to save time. It stole it.

quiz.question: How long does it take to refocus after an interruption according to Gloria Mark?
